Rule.Name: sMapiEnabledFalse
Rule.Title: Outlook will not be able to connect to the mailbox of '%USERDISPLAYNAME%'
Rule.Text: The MAPI protocol is disabled for the mailbox of user '%USERDISPLAYNAME%', so Outlook will not be able to connect to the user's mailbox. Please click the 'Click here ...' link for details on configuring the MapiEnabled attribute for this user.

Rule.Name: sUserMbxWithMasterAcctSid
Rule.Query: count(../Instance[(Setting[@Key1='msExchRecipientTypeDetails' and Value=1] or Setting[@Key1='msExchRecipientTypeDetails' and Value=2147483648]) and Setting[@Key1='msExchMasterAccountSid' and string-length(Value)>0]])>0
Rule.Title: Exchange connection issues because the account for '%USERDISPLAYNAME%' has the msExchMasterAccountSid attribute configured
Rule.Text: Exchange connection issues will occur because '%USERDISPLAYNAME%' has a 'User' mailbox and they also have the msExchMasterAccountSid attribute configured for their account. Please click the 'Click here ...' link for details on how to remove the msExchMasterAccountSid attribute for the Active Directory account of '%USERDISPLAYNAME%'.

Rule.Name: sUserAccountInAutomapList
Rule.Title: Problems with reminders, sending email, To-Do bar, or indexing
Rule.Text: The account for '%USERDISPLAYNAME%' is listed in the msExchangeDelegateListLink attribute in Active Directory. In some scenarios reminders don't fire, e-mail stays in the Outbox, the To-Do Bar displays errors, or Indexing of Outlook is frequently restarted. Please run the 'Test E-mail AutoConfiguration' tool and check the AlternativeMailbox section of the Autodiscover results to ensure the mailbox for '%USERDISPLAYNAME%' is not listed as a 'Delegate' mailbox.

Rule.Name: sDefaultProfileRegMissing15plus
Rule.Title: Incomplete Outlook scan due to missing registry data
Rule.Text: Your Outlook scan is incomplete. This is because you do not have a default profile specified for the DefaultProfile value under the 'HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook' registry key.
Rule.Symptoms: A failure occurred in the Outlook scan

Rule.Name: sDefaultProfileRegMissingPre15
Rule.Title: Incomplete Outlook scan due to missing registry data
Rule.Text: Your Outlook scan is incomplete. This is because you do not have a default profile specified for the DefaultProfile value under the 'HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows Messaging Subsystem\Profiles' registry key.
Rule.Symptoms: A failure occurred in the Outlook scan

Rule.Name: sOutlookPR
Rule.Title: The build number for Outlook.exe is for a Private Release (PR). This is an unsupported configuration.
Rule.Text: The build number for Outlook.exe '{0}' indicates a Private Release (PR) build. PR builds are intended only for testing and not production use. Please unininstall the hotfix related to this build number. Then, click the 'Click here ...' link and install the latest update listed in the referenced article.

Rule.Name: sMsgInTopOfInformationStore
Rule.Title: Some email messages are not displayed in your mailbox
Rule.Text: You have {0} message(s) in the server copy of the 'Top of Information Store' folder in your mailbox. If you have the 'Show home page by default ...' option enabled for this folder, you will not be able to see these email messages.

Rule.Name: sPROstOstIDOver32KBOnline
Rule.Title: Cannot connect with (or create new) cached mode profile
Rule.Text:
When you attempt to either start Outlook with a cached mode profile or create a new cached mode profile you receive an error ending in '... not enough memory to perform this operation'. This issue occurs when the size of the PR_OST_OSTID property in the hidden \Top of Information Store folder in your mailbox exceeds a certain value.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on how to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: sPROstOstIDOver30KB
Rule.Title: Possible future problems with cached mode profiles
Rule.Text:
The size of the PR_OST_OSTID property in the hidden \Top of Information Store folder in your mailbox is over 90% of the limit. Eventually, as you create new cached mode profiles for this mailbox, you will not be able to connect to the mailbox or create more cached mode profiles.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on how to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: ClosestGCOnEx14Plus
Rule.Title: Cause found for address book/delegation/additional mailbox, and archive mailbox issues (Closest GC registry value)
Rule.Text: The 'Closest GC' registry value =1 which is not supported because your mailbox is on Exchange 2010 (or later). In this environment, the CAS server is your Global Catalog. Here are things that can break if you do not go through the CAS for directory access: delegate / multiple mailbox access for older Outlook clients (2003), support for archive mailbox.

Rule.Name: ClosestGCOnEx0307
Rule.Title: Closest GC = 1 in the registry. This can affect which Global Catalog server is used by Outlook.
Rule.Text: The 'Closest GC' registry value =1. This can cause Outlook to use a different Global Catalog server than it would without this registry configuration. If you are having issues with address book, delegation and authentication functionality in Outlook, see if the problems continue without this registry data.

Rule.Name: DSServerOnEx14Plus
Rule.Title: Cause found for address book/delegation/additional mailbox, and archive mailbox issues (DS Server registry value)
Rule.Text: The 'DS Server' registry value = '%DSSERVER%' which is not supported because your mailbox is on Exchange 2010 (or later). In this environment the CAS server is your Global Catalog. Here are things that can break if you do not go through the CAS for directory access: delegate / multiple mailbox access for older Outlook clients (2003), support for archive mailbox.

Rule.Name: DSServerOnEx0307
Rule.Title: DS Server = '%DSSERVER%' in the registry. This can affect which Global Catalog server is used by Outlook.
Rule.Text: DS Server = '%DSSERVER%' in the registry. This can cause Outlook to use a different Global Catalog server than it would without this registry configuration. If you are having issues with address book, delegation and authentication functionality in Outlook, see if the problems continue without this registry data.

Rule.Name: sEncryptionOff15andAboveO
Rule.Title: Cannot connect to an Exchange mailbox because RPC Encryption is disabled
Rule.Text: Encryption of RPC traffic between Outlook and your Exchange Server is turned off. This can prevent you from connecting to Exchange if it requires RPC encryption (Exchange 2010 requires RPC encryption by default).

Rule.Title: RPC Encryption
Rule.Text: RPC Traffic encryption between Outlook and your Exchange Server is on.

Rule.Name: sEncryptionOff14O
Rule.Title: Cannot connect to an Exchange mailbox because RPC Encryption is disabled
Rule.Text: Encryption of RPC traffic between Outlook and your Exchange Server is turned off. This can prevent you from connecting to Exchange if it requires RPC encryption (Exchange 2010 requires RPC encryption by default).

Rule.Name: sEncryptionOn14O

Rule.Name: sEncryptionOff12O
Rule.Title: Cannot connect to an Exchange mailbox because RPC Encryption is disabled

Rule.Name: sEncryptionOn12O

Rule.Text: RPC Traffic encryption between Outlook and your Exchange Server is on.

Rule.Name: writeableDC
Rule.Title: No writeable GC: Error adding a delegate or updating a DL
Rule.Text: A 'writeable' Global Catalog server is not available. Without access to a writeable Global Catalog server, you may receive an error message when adding a delegate or updating a Distribution List.

Rule.Name: writeableDCWin78
Rule.Title: No writeable GC: Error adding a delegate or updating a DL
Rule.Text: A 'writeable' Global Catalog server is not available. Without access to a writeable Global Catalog server, you may receive an error message when adding a delegate or updating a Distribution List.

Rule.Name: sSendMailImmediately
Rule.Title: Email stays in the Outbox because 'Send Mail Immediately' = 0
Rule.Text:
The value 'Send Mail Immediately' = 0 is configured as a {0} setting. This configuration causes email messages to stay in the Outbox folder until you manually force a Send and Receive.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link for details on the registry path for the 'Send Mail Immediately' value. Then, update the {0} setting for this value.

Rule.Name: sLoadTransportProviders
Rule.P1: if($fLoadTransportProvidersPol=1,'your network administrator will need to change this group policy setting','change the value of LoadTransportProviders to 0')
Rule.Title: Email stays in the Outbox because LoadTransportProviders = 1
Rule.Text:
The value 'LoadTransportProviders' = 1 is configured as a {0} setting. This configuration causes email messages to stay in the Outbox folder. To update this value, {1}.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link for details on the registry path for the 'LoadTransportProviders' value.

Rule.Name: sSearchResultsCap1214
Rule.Query: (($n2DigitVersion=12 or $n2DigitVersion=14) and $fCachedMode and (($fSearchResultsCapPol1214>0 and $fSearchResultsCapPol1214<200) or ($fSearchResultsCapPol1214=-1 and ($fSearchResultsCap1214>0 and $fSearchResultsCap1214<200))))
Rule.Title: Your search results are limited due to the SearchResultsCap registry value
Rule.Text:
The default maximum number of results returned by a search in Outlook {1} is 200 items. Your search results are limited due to the {0} SearchResultsCap registry value.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link for details on the {0} registry path for the 'SearchResultsCap' value.

Rule.Name: sSearchResultsCap15
Rule.Title: Search results limited to 30 items
Rule.Text:
With your build of Outlook.exe, the default maximum number of results returned by a search in Outlook 2013 is 30 items. You can install a more recent build of Outlook.exe that provides a higher default limit (250).
Please click the 'Click here ...' link for details.

Rule.Name: sNoOAB12
Rule.Query: $nOABFiles12=0 and (($fDownloadOAB!=0 and $fPolDownloadOAB=-1) or $fPolDownloadOAB=1) and (($fANRIncludeOnlineGAL!=1 and $fPolANRIncludeOnlineGAL=-1) or $fPolANRIncludeOnlineGAL=0)
Rule.Title: Slowness/delays in Outlook because there are no .oab files on the computer
Rule.Text: You are in cached mode but there are no Offline Address Book (OAB) files on your computer. In this configuration, you can see long delays because Outlook must communicate with a server instead of accessing local information. And, if you are working offline you will not be able to resolve names.

Rule.Name: sStrictAccountOrder
Rule.Title: Some email may not be immediately sent because StrictAccountOrder = {0} in the registry
Rule.Text:
Some email remains in the Outbox folder until you manually initiate the Send/Receive process. This problem occurs because the StrictAccountOrder registry value is non-zero.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for information on how to change this setting.

Rule.Name: sAutoDiscLegDNLastCharBlankFullScan
Rule.Title: Outlook in a Disconnected state because the LegacyExchangeDN value ends with a space
Rule.Text:
The last character of the LegacyExchangeDN value found in the Autodiscover information is a space. This configuration is known to cause Outlook to disconnect from the server and to display an error message indicating you should 'quit and restart Outlook'.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on how to remove the space from the LegacyExchangeDN value.

Rule.Text:
When you right-click a Calendar folder and then click Share, the 'Publish to WebDAV Server' is missing because your administrator made changes to the Sharing Policy for your organization or your personal mailbox.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for additional details on this issue.

Rule.Text: Outlook is connected to Exchange using Mapi over HTTPs. Check the Connection Status dialog box to confirm.

Rule.Name: fMapiHttpConnected14
Rule.Text: Outlook 2010 is connected to Exchange using Mapi over HTTPs. Check the Connection Status dialog box to confirm.

Rule.Name: sMapiHttpDisabled
Rule.Title: The 'mapiHttp' protocol is disabled due to registry data
Rule.Text: In the registry, {0} and this is designed to disable the 'mapiHttp' protocol. Because the registry data does not immediately take effect, check the Connection Status dialog box to confirm the current protocol connection type. Please check with your administrator to make sure this is a desired configuration for Outlook.

Rule.Name: sAlternativeMailbox
Rule.Title: %AMDN%
Rule.Text: Type =%AMTYPE%

Rule.Name: sSameAddtlAndAutomappedMbx
Rule.Query: count(//Instance[@Type='ProfileSection' and Setting[@Key1='001f65d0' and contains(Value,'Delegate')] and Setting[@Key1='001f3001' and contains(Value,'%AMDN%')] and Setting[@Key1='001f3d09' and contains(Value,'MSEMS')]]) + count(//Instance[@Type='ProfileSection' and not(Setting[@Key1='001f65d0']) and Setting[@Key1='001f3001' and contains(Value,'%AMDN%')] and Setting[@Key1='001f3d09' and contains(Value,'MSEMS')]])=2
Rule.Title: Problems because the same mailbox '%AMDN%' is added twice to your profile
Rule.Text:
You have the mailbox for %AMDN% added as an additional mailbox in your profile. This mailbox is also being added through the automapping process. You can only add this mailbox using one method and your current configuration can cause numerous problems in Outlook.
To resolve this problem, click the 'Click here...' link and follow the steps to either remove the additional mailbox in your profile or stop the automapping of the additional mailbox.

Rule.Name: sAltMbxConnectionMapiHttp
Rule.Text: Connection method in Autodiscover response =MAPI/HTTP

Rule.Name: sAltMbxConnectionRpc
Rule.Text: Connection method in Autodiscover response =RPC

Rule.Name: sOnlineArchiveChangedConnection
Rule.P0: if($sMapiHttpDisabled,'MAPI/Http is disabled in the registry','MAPI/Http is disabled on the Exchange server')
Rule.Title: Possible problems accessing an Online Archive mailbox
Rule.Text:
Your Outlook configuration indicates the connection method with your Online Archive mailbox has changed from MAPI/Http to RPC because {0}.
If you are able to access your Online Archive mailbox at this time, please ignore this error.
If you are currently experiencing a problem accessing your Online Archive mailbox, please click the âClick here â¦â link for details on a resolution.

Rule.Name: sAutomappingDuplicateSelfStore
Rule.Title: Problems with reminders, sending email, To-Do bar, or indexing
Rule.Text: Your own mailbox is listed as a 'Delegate' mailbox in the Autodiscover information from your Exchange server. In this configuration, you will experience numerous problems in Outlook. If you have already configured Full Access permissions per KB article 2548313, make sure to also check the msExchDelegateListLink attribute for your account in Active Directory or the Configuration Details for this scan. Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on fixing this problem.

Rule.Name: sArchiveMailboxNotAccessible
Rule.Query: $nArchiveMailboxes>0 and ($nMapiHttpProtocol=0 or ($nMapiHttpProtocol=1 and $sMapiHttpDisabled)) and starts-with($sExVersion,'15.') and $sEmsmdb322013Version='15.0.4641.1001'
Rule.Title: Your archive mailbox is not accessible
Rule.Text: Your archive mailbox is not accessible because you have build 15.0.4641.1001 of Outlook 2013 installed. This build is from the August 2014 update. Click the 'Click here...' link for steps to resolve this issue.

Rule.Name: sAutomapMbxErrorEx14RU5or6
Rule.Title: Error accessing an additional mailbox: 'Cannot expand the folder ...'
Rule.Text: Your Outlook + Exchange configuration is known to cause the error 'Cannot expand the folder. The set of folders cannot be opened. The attempt to log on to Microsoft Exchange has failed.' when accessing additional mailboxes. Please install the latest build of Outlook 2010 to resolve this issue.

Rule.Name: sSharedFolderNotCopiedConfigMsiX86
Rule.Query: $nInstallType='MSI' and $bitness='x86' and $n2DigitVersion=15 and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4701.1000')<=0 and $fCachedMode and $nProfSyncWindowSetting!=0 and $nDelegateMailboxes>0
Rule.Title: Unable to move folders to shared mailbox in your configuration
Rule.Text:
Your Outlook cached mode configuration is set to download less than your entire mailbox and you do not have the update from at least April 2015 installed. In this configuration you will not be able to move folders from your mailbox to any shared mailbox also in your profile.
To resolve this problem, click the 'Click here...' link and then install the 32-bit Outlook update provided in the article. Or, click the 'Download the update ...' link to download the latest 32-bit update for Outlook 2013.

Rule.Name: sSharedFolderNotCopiedConfigMsiX64
Rule.Query: $nInstallType='MSI' and $bitness='x64' and $n2DigitVersion=15 and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4701.1000')<=0 and $fCachedMode and $nProfSyncWindowSetting!=0 and $nDelegateMailboxes>0
Rule.Title: Unable to move folders to shared mailbox in your configuration
Rule.Text:
Your Outlook cached mode configuration is set to download less than your entire mailbox and you do not have the update from at least April 2015 installed. In this configuration you will not be able to move folders from your mailbox to any shared mailbox also in your profile.
To resolve this problem, click the 'Click here...' link and then install the 64-bit Outlook update provided in the article. Or, click the 'Download the update ...' link to download the latest 64-bit update for Outlook 2013.

Rule.Name: sSharedFolderNotCopiedConfigC2R
Rule.Title: Unable to move folders to shared mailbox in your configuration
Rule.Text:
Your Outlook cached mode configuration is set to download less than your entire mailbox and you do not have the update from at least April 2015 installed. In this configuration you will not be able to move folders from your mailbox to any shared mailbox also in your profile.
To resolve this problem, click the 'Click here...' link to see details on this issue. Or, click the 'Download the update ...' link and update Office using the steps in the 'Get the latest version of Office' section of the article

Rule.Name: sExcludeHttpRedirect
Rule.Title: Possible problems due to the 'ExcludeHttpRedirect' registry value
Rule.Text: ExcludeHttpRedirect ={0} in the registry. Please make sure this is a desired configuration for Autodiscover as it can cause unexpected mailbox connection problems.

Rule.Name: sExcludeHttpRedirectO365
Rule.Title: Possible problems due to the 'ExcludeHttpRedirect' registry value
Rule.Text: The 'ExcludeHttpRedirect' value was found in the registry. This value is used by Autodiscover, and it can cause problems when your mailbox is on Office 365. Please check with your administrator to make sure this is a desired configuration.

Rule.Title: Possible problems due to the 'ExcludeLastKnownGoodUrl' registry value
Rule.Text: The 'ExcludeLastKnownGoodUrl' value is set to 1 in the registry. This configuration may impact the time it takes for Outlook to retrieve Autodiscover information from your Exchange server.

Rule.Name: sBootKeyFullScan
Rule.P0: if($MachineDetails_fAppSenseServiceFound,'You also have AppSense installed which has been known to add the Boot key into the registry.',false())
Rule.Title: Autodiscover, free/busy, OAB, and MailTips fail due to bad registry data
Rule.Text: The 'Boot' key was found in the registry under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\AutoDiscover\. This configuration can cause the failure of Autodiscover and Outlook features such as free/busy, OAB, and MailTips that use Autodiscover. {0}
Rule.Symptoms: Autodiscover,Exchange connection,Free Busy,MailTips,Offline Address Book (OAB),Outlook profile

Object.Name: Current User's Delegates From Active Directory
Current User's Delegators From Active Directory
Current User's Delegates From LocalFreeBusy Message

Rule.Name: DelegateWastebasketStyle
Rule.Title: Delegate receives an error deleting a meeting from a manager's calendar
Rule.Text:
DelegateWastebasketStyle=4 in the registry. In this configuration, a delegate will receive the following error message if they do not have at least Author permission to the Deleted Items folder in the owner's mailbox:
'Some items cannot be deleted. They were either moved or already deleted, or access was denied.'

Rule.Name: sDelegateSentItemsStyle
Rule.Title: Messages stay in the Outbox folder because DelegateSentItemsStyle=1 in the registry
Rule.Text: DelegateSentItemsStyle=1 in the registry, and your profile is in Online mode with Microsoft Exchange. In this configuration, email messages will remain in the Outbox if you send the messages from a shared mailbox.

Rule.Name: sDelegateSentItemsStylePol
Rule.Title: Messages stay in the Outbox folder because DelegateSentItemsStyle=1 as a group policy
Rule.Text: The DelegateSentItemsStyle value is set to 1 via group policy and your profile is in Online mode. This combination of settings is not supported. Please check with your administrator to discuss changing your profile or this policy.

Rule.Name: sDisableResponseButtons
Rule.Title: Meeting response options are missing in a meeting invite
Rule.Text: DisableResponseButtons=1 in the registry. In this configuration, a Manager (with a delegate) is unable to accept or decline meetings because Accept, Decline and Tentative are not listed under the 'Change Response' control no the Ribbon.

Rule.Name: sMissingPR_PROFILE_HOME_SERVER_ADDRS
Rule.Title: Error when adding an additional Exchange mailbox to a profile
Rule.Text: The 101e6613 property value is missing from your profile. You will not be able to manually add additional Exchange mailboxes to your profile. Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to resolve this issue.

Rule.Name: sOutlookMessageManagerMessagesFound
Rule.Title: Message(s) with Subject 'Outlook Message Manager' found in your Inbox
Rule.Text:
There are {0} email message(s) whose Subject starts with 'Outlook Message Manager' in your Inbox. These messages can safely be moved to the Deleted Items folder.
Please click the 'Click here...' link if you need additional information before deleting these messages.

Rule.Name: sMaxExtendRuleSizeLimit
Rule.Title: Error configuring Junk E-mail settings (due to PR_EXTENDED_RULE_SIZE_LIMIT property)
Rule.Text: The PR_EXTENDED_RULE_SIZE_LIMIT property is set to {0} bytes. Therefore, the Max Extended Rule Size registry value may be incorrectly configured on the Exchange server. In this configuration, you will receive error messages when trying to configure Junk E-mail settings in Outlook.

Rule.Name: sBlockedEncodingList
Rule.Title: Blocked Encoding List

Rule.Name: sBlockedTLDomainList
Rule.Title: Blocked Top-Level Domain List

Rule.Name: sJunkThresholdNone
Rule.Title: Junk Mail Threshold
Rule.Text: No spam filtering.

Rule.Name: sJunkThresholdLow
Rule.Title: Junk Mail Threshold
Rule.Text: Low spam filtering.

Rule.Name: sJunkThresholdHigh
Rule.Title: Junk Mail Threshold
Rule.Text: High spam filtering.

Rule.Name: sJunkThresholdTrustedListsOnly
Rule.Title: Junk Mail Threshold
Rule.Text: Trusted Lists Only.

Rule.Name: sRuleMsgState
Rule.Title: Error configuring Junk E-mail settings (due to PR_RULE_MSG_STATE property)
Rule.Text: The PR_RULE_MSG_STATE property on the Junk E-Mail Rule message is set to {0}. This configuration can cause an error when trying to configure Junk E-mail settings in Outlook.

Rule.Name: sJunkPermanentlyDelete
Rule.Title: Junk e-mail messages are permanently deleted
Rule.Text: Junk e-mail messages are being permanently deleted because of your Junk E-mail settings are configured to delete all e-mail considered as Junk. Click the 'Click here ...' link if you need information on changing your settings.

Rule.Name: sJunkIncludeContacts
Rule.Title: Error configuring Junk E-mail settings ('Also trust e-mail from my Contacts' option is enabled)
Rule.Text: The 'Also trust e-mail from my Contacts' option is enabled in your Junk E-mail settings. In this configuration, the hidden Junk E-mail Rule may be larger than expected and you may receive an error when trying to configure Junk E-mail settings.

Rule.Name: sJunkEmailFeatureDisabled
Rule.Title: The Junk E-mail feature is disabled by a group policy setting
Rule.Text: The Junk E-mail feature is disabled in the registry by the DisableAntiSpam group policy setting. In this configuration, you will not be able to configure Junk E-mail settings and the junk e-mail filter in Outlook will not process e-mail messages.

Rule.Name: sOutlookEnableSpoofyEmails
Rule.Title: Outlook slowness because the OutlookEnableSpoofyEmails value is set as a group policy
Rule.Text: OutlookEnableSpoofyEmails=1 as a group policy setting in the registry and your Outlook profile is in Online mode. In this configuration, Outlook may cause the transaction logs to grow on your mailbox (Exchange) server.

Rule.Name: sSCLIgnoredOL14E15
Rule.Query: not($fAuthServiceProblemValuePol) and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'14.0.7116.5000')<0 and (($fEXCHAuthPackage='Anonymous') or ($fEXCHAuthPackage=false() and $sEncryptionOff14O=1)) and starts-with($sExVersion,'15.') and $fDisableAntiSpam!=1 and not($sJunkThresholdNone=1)
Rule.Title: Messages unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder because Outlook is out of date
Rule.Text: Your mailbox is either on Office 365 or an on-premise Exchange 2013 server and Anonymous authentication is configured in your Outlook profile. You also have Junk E-mail settings at something other than 'off'. In this configuration, some email may unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder. Click the 'Click here ...' link and then install the update listed in the referenced article.

Rule.Name: sSCLIgnoredOL15E15
Rule.Query: not($fAuthServiceProblemValuePol) and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4605.1000')<0 and (($fEXCHAuthPackage='Anonymous') or ($fEXCHAuthPackage=false() and $sEncryptionOff15andAboveO=1)) and starts-with($sExVersion,'15.') and $fDisableAntiSpam!=1 and not($sJunkThresholdNone=1)
Rule.Title: Messages unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder because Outlook is out of date
Rule.Text: Your mailbox is either on Office 365 or an on-premise Exchange 2013 server and Anonymous authentication is configured in your Outlook profile. You also have Junk E-mail settings at something other than 'off'. In this configuration, some email may unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder. Click the 'Click here ...' link and then install the update listed in the referenced article.

Rule.Name: sSCLIgnoredOL12E15
Rule.Title: Messages unexpectedly go to Junk E-mail for an Exchange 2013 or Office 365 mailbox
Rule.Text: Your mailbox is on Exchange Server 2013 and you also have Junk E-mail settings at something other than 'off'. In this configuration, some email may unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder in Outlook 2007. Click the 'Click here...' link and then follow the guidance under 'The workarounds available for Outlook 2007 users connecting to Exchange 2013 are to' in the article.

Rule.Name: sSCLIgnoredLTEx15NoEncrypt
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=12 and number(substring($sExVersion,1,2))<=14 and $sEncryptionOff12O and $fDisableAntiSpam!=1 and not($sJunkThresholdNone=1)
Rule.Title: Messages unexpectedly go to Junk E-mail because encryption is disabled
Rule.Text: Your Outlook 2007 profile for Exchange Server 2010 (or earlier) does not have Encryption enabled and you also have Junk E-mail settings at something other than 'off'. In this configuration, some email may unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder. Click the 'Click here ...' link and then follow the guidance under 'If connecting to Microsoft Exchange 2010 and earlier' in the article.

Rule.Name: sRemindersDisabled
Rule.Title: Reminders are disabled
Rule.Text: Reminders are disabled. If reminders are not being managed by group policy, you can re-enable them through Advanced settings in the Outlook Options dialog box.

Setting.Key2: Automatically accept meeting requests and process cancellations

Rule.Name: sRoomFinderShow
Rule.Title: Room Finder partially hidden by the RoomFinderShow registry value
Rule.Text: RoomFinderShow=0 in the registry. In this configuration the Room Finder will not appear on the Appointment tab when you schedule a meeting.

Rule.Name: sRoomFinderForceDisabled
Rule.Title: Room Finder disabled by the RoomFinderForceDisabled registry value
Rule.Text: RoomFinderForceDisabled=1 in the registry. In this configuration, the Room Finder is not available when you schedule meetings in Outlook.

Rule.Name: sRoomFinderShowPol
Rule.Title: Room Finder partially hidden by the RoomFinderShow group policy value
Rule.Text: RoomFinderShow=0 in the \Policies section of the registry. In this configuration the Room Finder will not appear on the Appointment tab when you schedule a meeting.

Rule.Name: sRoomFinderForceDisabledPol
Rule.Title: Room Finder disabled by the RoomFinderForceDisabled group policy value
Rule.Text: RoomFinderForceDisabled=1 in the \Policies section of the registry. In this configuration, the Room Finder is not available when you schedule meetings in Outlook.

Rule.Name: sRoomFinderAddinDisabled
Rule.Title: Room Finder hidden because 'Microsoft Exchange Add-In' is not enabled.
Rule.Text: The 'Microsoft Exchange Add-In' add-in is disabled. In this configuration, the Room Finder is not available when you schedule meetings in Outlook.

Rule.Name: sSnifferLockOwner
Rule.Title: Receipts and responses are not processed automatically in your Inbox folder by Outlook
Rule.Text: The 'Sniffer Lock' is owned by another machine: %SNIFFOWNER%. If Inbox items (Read Receipts, voting responses, or meeting invites/responses) are not getting processed automatically by Outlook, click the 'Click here ...' link for details on the sniffer lock.

Rule.Name: SnifferInfo
Rule.Title: Sniffer Lock Owner
Rule.Text: The current Sniffer Lock Owner is the '%SNIFFOWNER%' computer since {0}.

Rule.Name: AutoProcessIdleTimeH
Rule.Title: Outlook does not process items because the AutoProcessIdleTime is too high
Rule.Text: AutoProcessIdleTime is too high (%APID% ms). In this configuration, responses or receipts are not processed as expected.

Rule.Name: AutoProcessIdleTimel
Rule.Title: Outlook does not process items because the AutoProcessIdleTime is too low
Rule.Text: AutoProcessIdleTime is too low (%APID% ms). In this configuration, responses or receipts are not processed as expected.

Rule.Name: SnifferOff
Rule.Title: Receipts and responses not processed automatically because 'Sniffer' is disabled
Rule.Text: Automatic processing for meeting requests, read receipts and voting responses does not occur because the 'Automatically process meeting requests and responses to meeting requests and polls' setting (sniffer) is not enabled.

Rule.Name: SnifferOn
Rule.Title: Outlook Automatic Processing (Sniffer) configuration
Rule.Text: Automatic processing for meeting requests is enabled.

Rule.Name: sAutomateProcessingNone
Rule.Title: Meetings not processed by Exchange because AutomateProcessing = None
Rule.Text: When AutomateProcessing = None the Exchange Calendar Assistant is not automatically processing meeting requests for a mailbox. This is not the default configuration. Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on making this change to this setting.

Rule.Name: sAutomateProcessingAutoUpdate
Rule.Title: AutomateProcessing = AutoUpdate
Rule.Text: AutomateProcessing = AutoUpdate.

Rule.Name: sAutomateProcessingAutoAccept
Rule.Title: Messages unexpectedly deleted because AutomateProcessing = AutoAccept
Rule.Text: The AutomateProcessing parameter cannot be set to AutoAccept for 'User' mailboxes. If this is a 'User' mailbox, change the AutomateProcessing parameter to AutoUpdate. Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on making this change.
Rule.Symptoms: Meetings or appointments,Email missing or deleted

Rule.Name: scalAssistAddNewItemsInfo
Rule.Title: Calendar Assistant is configured to add new meetings tentatively to the Calendar
Rule.Text: Calendar Assistant is configured to add new meetings tentatively to the Calendar

Rule.Name: scalAssistAddNewItemsWarning
Rule.Title: New meetings are not automatically added to the Calendar
Rule.Text: The configuration of the Exchange Calendar Assistant for your mailbox has the AddNewRequestsTentatively parameter set to False. Therefore, new meetings will not be added tentatively to your calendar unless Outlook is running. Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on making a change to the AddNewRequestsTentatively parameter.

Rule.Name: sFreeBusy
Rule.Title: Free/Busy Publish Range
Rule.Text: Policy Setting = {0} months. User setting (lowest priority)={2} months. Availability Options: piFBPublishRange = {3} months, piFBUserPublishRange= {1} months.

Rule.Name: sFBZeroPolPubRange
Rule.Title: Other users may not be able to see your calendar free/busy information
Rule.Text: The Free/Busy Publish Range is set to 0 months by group policy. Other users will be unable to see your free/busy information if they are not using the Exchange 2007/2010 Availability Service to retrieve free/busy information.

Rule.Name: spiFBPublishRangeBug
Rule.Title: Calendar free/busy publishing information incomplete because Outlook is out of date
Rule.Text: The Free/busy range setting in your mailbox does not match the free/busy publishing range specified by group policy. In this configuration, some users may not see all of your calendar free/busy information. This issue was fixed by the update in KB article 2596485. To correct this problem, please install the latest cumulative update for Outlook 2010.

Rule.Name: sFBZeroAvailOptionPubRange
Rule.Title: Your free/busy information may not be seen by other users
Rule.Text: The Free/Busy Publish range stored in a hidden message in your mailbox is set to 0 months. Other users will be unable to see your free/busy information if they are not using the Exchange 2007 (or later) Availability Service to retrieve free/busy information. Update the 'Publish' value in the Outlook Free/Busy Options dialog box.

Rule.Name: sFBZeroUserPubRange
Rule.Title: Other users may not see your calendar Free/Busy information because you are publishing 0 months
Rule.Text: The free/busy Publish value is set to 0 months in the Outlook Free/Busy Options. Other users will be unable to see your free/busy information if they are not using the Exchange 2007 (or later) Availability Service to retrieve free/busy information.

Rule.Name: UselegacyFB1
Rule.Title: Suggestion Pane is missing because UseLegacyFB=1 in the registry
Rule.Text:
When scheduling a meeting, the Suggestion Pane is missing and Outlook uses public folder free/busy information instead of the Exchange availability service. This occurs because UseLegacyFB=1 in the registry under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\12.0\Outlook\Options\Calendar.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details and automated solutions on changing this registry value.

Rule.Name: UselegacyFB2
Rule.Title: UseLegacyFB=1 on Outlook 2010 (or later) client
Rule.Text: The UseLegacyFB registry value was found in the registry. It is not used by Outlook 2010 or later.

Rule.Name: sEnableDirectBooking
Rule.Title: Obsolete value (EnableDirectBooking) found in the registry
Rule.Text: The EnableDirectBooking value is set to 1 in the registry. Direct booking was deprecated in Outlook 2013, so this registry value will not be used by Outlook.

Object.Name: Number of ignored or automatically moved conversations =%IGNOREDCONVROWS%
All messages in the conversation with subject '%CONVSUBJECT%' are being ignored and automatically moved to the 'Deleted Items' folder
All messages in the conversation with subject '%CONVSUBJECT%' are being automatically moved to the '%FLDMOVENAME%' folder

Rule.Name: sIgnoredConversationsCount
Rule.Title: Messages in some email conversations are being ignored (deleted) or automatically moved
Rule.Text: Outlook is automatically ignoring (deleting) or moving {0} email conversation(s) from the Inbox folder. Click the 'Click here ...' link for information on how to stop Outlook from ignoring or moving these messages. Note, advanced users can use the 'Find' feature in the Configuration Details view of this report to search for 'ignored conversations'.

Rule.Name: sNullNNC
Rule.Title: Outlook does not make a suggestion to automatically complete email addresses
Rule.Text: The property in your mailbox that contains the nickname cache (autocomplete feature) may be corrupted as it has a value of NULL. In this situation, Outlook cannot make a suggestion to automatically complete email addresses. Click the 'Click here ...' link to see steps to resolve this problem.

Rule.Name: sNNCWarning
Rule.Title: Email addresses for some people may not auto-complete because you have not recently sent them email
Rule.Text: The auto-complete (nickname) cache has a pre-defined total number of entries it can contain: {0}. The number of items in your cache, {1}, exceeds 90 percent of this limit. When you reach the limit, Outlook will start removing the oldest entries from the cache. These will be the entries for the people you have not recently emailed.

Rule.Name: sMissingNNC
Rule.Title: Outlook does not make a suggestion to automatically complete email addresses
Rule.Text: The nickname cache is missing from your mailbox and the "Automatic name checking" option is enabled. In this situation, Outlook cannot make a suggestion to automatically complete email addresses. Click the 'Click here ...' link to see steps to resolve this problem.

Rule.Name: sNicknameLongTermSaveDelay
Rule.Title: NicknameLongTermSaveDelay value in the registry is too high or too low
Rule.Text: NicknameLongTermSaveDelay = {0} in the registry and the default value is 600000. A setting above the default can cause delays in nickname cache updates and a setting below the default may impact performance on your Exchange server.

Rule.Name: sUMEnabledUser
Rule.Text: User is UM Enabled

Rule.Name: sManageVoiceMailMissing
Rule.Title: The 'Manage Voice Mail' control is missing from the File tab (backstage) in Outlook
Rule.Text: You are 'voice mail enabled' and you are connecting to your Exchange mailbox using MAPI/HTTP. But, the 'Microsoft Exchange Add-in' is out of date. In this configuration, the 'Manage Voice Mail' control is not displayed on the File tab (also known as the backstage) in Outlook. Click the 'Click here ...' link and then install the latest update for the add-in (Outexum-x-none.msp).

Object.Name: Messages in the Receive Folder table

Rule.Name: sReceiveFolderMsgClassSchedule
Rule.Title: Meeting invitations do not appear in the Inbox folder but the meeting appears tentatively on the Calendar
Rule.Text:
Invitations to meetings are being deleted automatically and never appear in the Inbox folder. However, the meeting appears on the Calendar in a tentatively accepted state. This occurs because a hidden message in the hidden 'Receive Folder' table has a message clase = 'IPM.SCHEDULE.MEETING'.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on the solution.
Rule.Symptoms: Calendar,Email missing or deleted,Meetings or appointments

Rule.Name: sOscFbAccountFound1214
Rule.Title: Facebook updates stop working
Rule.Text:
Due to recent changes made by Facebook, the Outlook Social Connector (OSC) connection to Facebook will no longer function. Because of this change, you see an 'Invalid user name or password' error in the OSC dialog box and updates with Facebook no longer occur.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on removing your Facebook connection in the OSC.

Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on how to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: sStrictAccountOrder2003

Rule.Text:
Some email remains in the Outbox folder until you manually initiate the Send/Receive process. This problem occurs because the StrictAccountOrder registry value is non-zero.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for information on how to change this setting.

Rule.Name: sNNCWarning11
Rule.Title: Email addresses for some people may not auto-complete due to large nickname cache
Rule.Text:
The auto-complete (nickname) cache has a pre-defined total number of entries it can contain: {0}. The number of items in your cache, {1}, exceeds 90 percent of this limit. When you reach the limit, Outlook will start removing the oldest entries from the cache. These will be the entries for the people you have not recently emailed.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for additional details.

Rule.Name: sVerifaceImagereogDllFound
Rule.Title: Third-party software may cause Outlook to stay at the 'Looking for credentials' dialog box
Rule.Text:
The third-party VeriFace software product has Imagereog.dll loaded in the Outlook.exe process. Under some conditions, this software has been seen to prevent Outlook from connecting to your Exchange mailbox.
If Outlook does not get past the 'Looking for credentials' dialog box, click the 'Click here ...' link to see a possible solution.

Rule.Name: sAppSensePvcDllAndCitrixFound
Rule.Title: Outlook stability issues with AppSense software installed in a Citrix environment
Rule.Text:
The AppSense virtualization software has a file called Pvc.dll loaded in the Outlook.exe process. The version you have has been known to cause Outlook to stop responding in a Citrix environment. Please consider updating the AppSense software if Outlook is not stable.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this issue.

Rule.Name: sAppSenseLockDownMgrDllAndCitrixFound
Rule.Title: Outlook stability issues with AppSense software installed in a Citrix environment
Rule.Text:
The AppSense virtualization software has a file called LockDownMgr.dll loaded in the Outlook.exe process. The version you have has been known to cause Outlook to stop responding in a Citrix environment. Please consider updating the AppSense software if Outlook is not stable.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this issue.

Rule.Name: sDMOLHelperDll531xFound
Rule.Title: Possible Outlook stability issue with DmOLHelper.dll loaded
Rule.Text:
The DMOLHelper.dll file (version 5.3.1.x) is loaded in the Outlook.exe process. Certain versions of this file have been known to cause Outlook to stop responding or crash. Please consider updating your Open Text software if Outlook is not stable.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this issue.

The 'iCloud Outlook Addin' add-in (APLZOD32.dll version 4.2.26.0) is installed on your computer. This version has been known to cause email messages to remain unsent in the Outbox folder. If you have problems with email not getting sent, try disabling the 'iCloud Outlook Addin'.

Rule.Name: sSVRLTMGR64DllFound

Rule.Title: Possible crashing issue due to third party file Dpofeedb.dll
Rule.Text:
Outlook may crash when you work with shared calendars if a third-party add-in installs certain versions of Dpofeedb.dll.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this issue.

Rule.Name: sFineReader9Detected
Rule.Title: Possible crashing issues with the FineReader 9.0 add-in enabled
Rule.Text:
The FineReader add-in is installed. Older versions have been known to cause Outlook to crash. Update or disable the FineReader add-in if you are experiencing crashes in Outlook.
For steps on disabling this add-in, click the 'Click here ...' link and then follow the steps in the 'Disabling the ABBYY FineReader add-in' section of the article.

Rule.Name: sMsoAuthDisabled
Rule.Title: MsoAuthDisabled=1 in the registry which is not a recommended configuration
Rule.Text: The MsoAuthDisabled value is set to 1 under the HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Exchange key in the registry. This is not a recommended configuration. Please change the value to 0 or delete the MsoAuthDisabled value.

Rule.Name: sOutlookLoggingEnabled
Rule.Title: Possible slowness because Outlook logging is enabled
Rule.Text:
Outlook logging is currently enabled. If you are not troubleshooting an Outlook issue, we recommend you disable Outlook logging as logging may slow Outlook's performance.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on where this setting is configurable in Outlook and the registry.

Rule.Name: sDisableBasicAuthSavedCreds14
Rule.Title: Unexpected prompt for password because DisableBasicAuthSavedCreds=1 in the registry
Rule.Text:
DisableBasicAuthSavedCreds =1 as a non-policy value in the registry. In this configuration, your credentials are not saved -- even if you select 'Remember my credentials' when prompted for your password.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: sDisableCopyToFileSystem
Rule.Title: Error message caused by the DisableCopyToFileSystem registry value
Rule.Text:
DisableCopyToFileSystem is configured as a {0} value in the registry. This value does not work in your build '{1}' of Outlook.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this issue and a fix for Outlook.

Rule.Name: sWrongRegTypeNoOSTOfflineScan
Rule.Title: Search in Outlook may be broken because of the NoOST registry value
Rule.Text:
The NoOST value in the registry is of type {0}. The correct type of registry value for NoOST is DWORD.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to fix this problem.

Rule.Title: Possible mailbox connection issues due to the 'ExcludeHttpRedirect' registry value
Rule.Text:
ExcludeHttpRedirect ={0} in the registry. This configuration may cause problems with Office 365 mailboxes. Please make sure this is a desired configuration for Autodiscover.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Text:

Rule.Name: sExcludeLastKnownGoodUrlOfflineScan
Rule.Title: Possible mailbox connection issues due to the 'ExcludeLastKnownGoodUrl' registry value
Rule.Text:
The ExcludeLastKnownGoodUrl value is set to 1 in the registry. This configuration may impact the time it takes for Outlook to retrieve Autodiscover information from your Exchange server.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: sBootKeyOfflineScan
Rule.P0: if($MachineDetails_fAppSenseServiceFound,'You also have AppSense installed which has been known to add the Boot key into the registry.',false())
Rule.Title: Autodiscover and Outlook features (free/busy, OAB, and MailTips) may not function
Rule.Text:
The 'Boot' key was found in the registry under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\AutoDiscover\. This configuration can cause the failure of Autodiscover and Outlook features such as free/busy, OAB, and MailTips that use Autodiscover. {0}
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to remove this registry key.
Rule.Symptoms: Autodiscover,Exchange connection,Free Busy,MailTips,Offline Address Book (OAB),Outlook profile

Rule.Name: sDownloadOAB
Rule.Title: The Offline Address Book may not be downloaded due to the DownloadOAB registry value
Rule.Text:
DownloadOAB=0 in the registry under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\Cached Mode. In this configuration, Outlook will not automatically download the Offline Address Book (OAB) if you do not have any .oab files already downloaded.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: sWrongRegTypeNoOST
Rule.Title: Search may be broken because the NoOST registry value is the wrong type
Rule.Text:
The NoOST registry value is of type {0}. The correct type of registry value for NoOST is DWORD.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to update the registry.

Rule.Name: sO365UseWindowsUserCredentials
Rule.Title: Possible Outlook Connection problems due to the UseWindowsUserCredentials registry value
Rule.Text:
UseWindowsUserCredentials = 1 in the registry. This configuration has been known to cause Autodiscover and Outlook profile creation to fail if your mailbox is in Office 365. You can ignore this warning if your mailbox is not in Office 365.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to update the registry.

Rule.Name: sDisableBasicAuthSavedCreds15
Rule.Title: Unexpected prompt for password because DisableBasicAuthSavedCreds=1 in the registry
Rule.Text:
DisableBasicAuthSavedCreds =1 as a non-policy value in the registry. In this configuration, your credentials are not saved -- even if you select 'Remember my credentials' when prompted for your password.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: sDefConnectOptsZeroMapiHttpX86
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=15 and $bitness='x86' and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4701.1000')<0 and $fDefConnectOptsPol=-1 and $fDefConnectOpts=0 and ($fMapiHttpMailstoreIntUrlOffline or $fMapiHttpMailstoreExtUrlOffline) and not($fMapiHttpDisabledPol=1 or ($fMapiHttpDisabledPol=-1 and $fMapiHttpDisabled=1))
Rule.Title: Unable to connect to mailbox because DefConnectOpts=0 plus MAPI/HTTP connection
Rule.Text:
Your Outlook profile is configured to connect with your Exchange mailbox using MAPI/HTTP and DefConnectOpts=0 in the registry under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\RPC. However, you may not be able to connect with your mailbox because you have an older build of Outlook installed.
If you are unable to connect to your mailbox, click the 'Click here ...' link to read the article that first addressed this issue. Or, click the 'Download the update ...' link for the latest Outlook update (32-bit).

Rule.Name: sDefConnectOptsZeroMapiHttpX64
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=15 and $bitness='x64' and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4701.1000')<0 and $fDefConnectOptsPol=-1 and $fDefConnectOpts=0 and ($fMapiHttpMailstoreIntUrlOffline or $fMapiHttpMailstoreExtUrlOffline) and not($fMapiHttpDisabledPol=1 or ($fMapiHttpDisabledPol=-1 and $fMapiHttpDisabled=1))
Rule.Title: Unable to connect to mailbox because DefConnectOpts=0 plus MAPI/HTTP connection
Rule.Text:
Your Outlook profile is configured to connect with your Exchange mailbox using MAPI/HTTP and DefConnectOpts=0 in the registry under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\RPC. However, you may not be able to connect with your mailbox because you have an older build of Outlook installed.
If you are unable to connect to your mailbox, click the 'Click here ...' link to read the article that first addressed this issue. Or, click the 'Download the update ...' link for the latest Outlook update (64-bit).

Rule.Name: sDisableEASEnabled
Rule.Title: Cannot add an Exchange ActiveSync account to the Outlook profile.
Rule.Text:
The option to add an Exchange ActiveSync account to the Outlook profile is disabled because the value 'DisableEAS' = 1 is configured as a non-policy setting in the registry.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Text:

Rule.Text:
The option to add an email account listed under 'Other' to the Outlook profile is disabled because the value 'DisableOtherTypes' = 1 is configured as a non-policy setting in the registry.

Rule.Name: sJunkMailProtect
Rule.Title: Junk email settings do not work as expected due to invalid registry data
Rule.Text:
The registry contains an invalid value for the Outlook Junk Email "No Protection" setting (Junkmailprotection value = 7fffffff). This occurs when you deploy Office 2010 with an MSP file created by the Office Customization Tool (OCT).
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on fixing this problem.

Rule.Name: SendPicturesWithDocument1214
Rule.Title: Images in email messages may not be displayed for the recipient
Rule.Text:
The 'Send Pictures with Document' value is set to 0 in the registry. In this configuration, recipients of email you send may see a red X instead of some images.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: fSendPicsWithDoc
Rule.Query: if(../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Send Pictures With Document'],../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Send Pictures With Document']/Value,-1)

Rule.Name: SendPicturesWithDocument15AndAbove
Rule.Title: Images in email messages may not be displayed for the recipient
Rule.Text:
The 'Send Pictures with Document' value is not set to 1 in the registry. In this configuration, recipients of email you send may see a red X instead of some images.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: OlMinToTray
Rule.Title: Outlook application icon is missing from the Windows taskbar
Rule.Text:
The "Hide when minimized" option is enabled for Outlook. In this configuration, the Outlook icon will not appear in the Windows taskbar if you minimize the Outlook window.
If you do not prefer this behavior, click the 'Click here ...' link for instructions on changing this setting.

Rule.Name: sSaveSent
Rule.Title: Copies of email messages are not saved in the Sent Items folder
Rule.Text:
The value 'SaveSent' = 0 as a {0} setting in the registry. This configuration causes email messages to not get saved in the Sent Items folder.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link for details on the registry path for the 'SaveSent' value. Then, update the {0} setting for this value.

Rule.Name: sPSTNullFreeOnClose
Rule.Title: Slow Outlook shut down because PSTNullFreeOnClose=1 in the registry
Rule.Text:
PSTNullFreeOnClose=1 in the registry under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\PST. This can cause Outlook to take longer than expected to exit and Outlook.exe may remain running in the background.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this registry value.

Rule.Name: sUseLegacyCacheSize15Plus
Rule.Title: Outlook displays errors on launch because UseLegacyCacheSize=1 in the registry
Rule.Text:
UseLegacyCacheSize=1 in the registry under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\PST. This prevents Outlook from starting.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on how to change this registry value.

Rule.Name: sEnableRememberPWD
Rule.P1: if($fEnableRememberPWDPol=0,'your network administrator will need to change this group policy setting','change the value of EnableRememberPWD to 1 in the registry')
Rule.Title: Unexpected prompt for password because EnableRememberPWD = 0 in the registry
Rule.Text:
The value 'EnableRememberPwd' = 0 is a {0} value in the registry. This configuration can cause an unexpected prompt for credentials with an Exchange mailbox and/or online archive. To update this value, {1}.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link for details on the registry path for the 'EnableRememberPWD' value.

Rule.Name: sAuthenticationService
Rule.P1: if($fAuthServiceProblemValuePol,'your network administrator will need to change this group policy setting','change the value of AuthenticationService in the registry')
Rule.Title: Prompt for password (Office 365 mailboxes only) because AuthenticationService = 9, 10, or 16 in the registry
Rule.Text:
The value of AuthenticationService is {2} and is configured as a {0} value in the registry. If you have an Office 365 mailbox, this configuration can cause an unexpected prompt for credentials. To update this value, {1}.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link for details on the registry path for the 'AuthenticationService' value.

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOff
Rule.Title: VBA functionality is disabled due to the VBAOff registry value
Rule.Text:
The VBAOff value in the HKCU registry hive is set to a value of 1. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this registry value.

Rule.Name: sUseOnlineContentOff
Rule.Title: Weather feature in Outlook is disabled
Rule.Text:
The weather feature is disabled in Outlook because the 'Allow Office to connect to the Internet' option is not enabled in the Trust Center.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to re-enable this option.

Rule.Name: sUseOnlineContentZeroO365Mbx
Rule.Title: Password prompt on every Outlook start because the UseOnlineContent=0 in the registry
Rule.Text:
In the registry, UseOnlineContent=0 under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\Internet. This configuration disables the 'Allow Office to connect to the Internet' option in the Trust Center. It also causes a prompt for your password every time you start Outlook.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to re-enable this option.

Rule.Name: sLatinFontSettingBlankOL
Rule.Title: Text in email messages may display as unreadable characters
Rule.Text:
The text in email messages you receive may contain characters that are unreadable. This problem occurs when the 'Latin' string value in the registry under {0} is blank.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to fix this issue.

Rule.Name: sWordOptionsAssistFound
Rule.Title: Outlook cannot preview a Word document
Rule.Text:
The registry contains the following subkey: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\15.0\Word\Options\Assist. When the registry contains this subkey, Outlook cannot preview a Word document.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to fix this issue.

Rule.Name: sSendToOneNoteMissing
Rule.Title: The OneNote icon is missing from the Outlook ribbon
Rule.Text:
Under Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\OneNote\Options\OutlookAndWeb in the registry, DisableSendEmailToOneNote=1. In this configuration Outlook does not display the OneNote icon on the ribbon.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for information on how to change the registry so the OneNote icon appears in Outlook.

Rule.Name: sOLK14PlusLync15SearchX86
Rule.Title: Cannot open Outlook items using Search in Windows
Rule.Text:
When you use the Search functionality in Windows you are unable to open Outlook items returned in your search results. This occurs because you have Outlook 2010 plus Lync 2013 installed.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link for the resolution.

Rule.Name: sOLK14PlusLync15SearchX64

Rule.Text:

Please click the 'Click here ...' link for the resolution.

Rule.Name: sHklmVBAOff

Rule.Text:
The VBAOff value = 1 in the registry under the HKLM hive. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this registry value.

Rule.Name: sFirewallPublicOutboundBlocked
Rule.Title: Unexpected password prompt because outbound connections are blocked by the Windows firewall
Rule.Text:
You may receive unexpected prompts for your password because the 'Outbound connection' setting is set to 'Block' on the Public Profile tab in the Windows Firewall configuration.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on how to resolve this problem.

Rule.Name: sOutlookLoggingEnabledPol
Rule.Title: Possible slowness because Outlook logging is enabled
Rule.Text:
Outlook logging is currently enabled through group policy. If you are not troubleshooting an Outlook issue, we recommend you disable Outlook logging as logging may slow Outlook's performance. Please ask your administrator to disable the policy configured for Outlook logging.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for additional information.

Rule.Name: sDisableBasicAuthSavedCredsPol14

DisableBasicAuthSavedCreds =1 as a group policy value in the registry. In this configuration, your credentials are not saved -- even if you select 'Remember my credentials' when prompted for your password.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: sDCACBadType
Rule.Title: Policy to prevent copying email from your mailbox does not work
Rule.Text:
The DisableCrossAccountCopy value is configured by group policy. However, the registry value is the wrong type -{0}- it should be of type REG_MULTI_SZ. In this configuration, Outlook does not restrict you (when it should) from copying or moving organizational email messages to an Outlook Data (.pst) file or other email account.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for the details on this setting.

Rule.Text:

Rule.Name: sExcludeLastKnownGoodUrlPolOfflineScan

Rule.Name: sDownloadOABPol

Rule.Text:
DownloadOAB=0 in the registry as a group policy setting under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\Cached Mode. In this configuration, Outlook will not automatically download the Offline Address Book (OAB) if you do not have any .oab files already downloaded. Check with your administrator to ensure this is an appropriate configuration for Outlook.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: sDelegateAccessDisabledByPolicy

Rule.Text:
On your computer, when you click the File tab in Outlook and then click Account Settings, the Delegate Access item is disabled (grayed out). This is due to a 'TCID*' value (20103) under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\DisabledCmdBarItemsList.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details.

Rule.Name: sRequiredCAPol
Rule.Title: A Required Certificate Authority (CA) is specified by policy
Rule.Text:
There is a group policy setting 'RequiredCA' that is specifying a required Certficate Authority (CA) '{0}' to be used for Outlook security profiles. With this policy configured, users are unable to sign email messages using a certificate from a different CA.
See HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\Security in the registry.

Rule.Name: sOffCAT80004004Error
Rule.Title: Offline scan forced by OffCAT due to group policy values for Outlook object model access
Rule.Text:
OffCAT performed an automatic Offline scan because {0}{1}{2} =0 under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\Security.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to resolve this problem.

Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: sPSTNullFreeOnClosePol
Rule.Title: Slow shut down because PSTNullFreeOnClose=1 as a group policy setting
Rule.Text:
PSTNullFreeOnClose=1 under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\PST in the registry. This can cause Outlook to take longer than expected to exit and and Outlook.exe may remain running in the background. See your Administrator to change this policy.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: sPSTPoliciesIgnoredWithDisableCrossAccoutCopy
Rule.Title: PST file group policy settings are ignored
Rule.Text:
Either PSTDisableGrow or DisablePST are deployed by group policy. However, they are ignored by Outlook because the DisableCrossAccountCopy setting is also deployed by group policy.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this issue.

Rule.Name: sO365UseWindowsUserCredentialsPol
Rule.Title: Office 365 connection problems due to the UseWindowsUserCredentials group policy value
Rule.Text:
UseWindowsUserCredentials = 1 under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\RPC in the registry. This configuration has been known to cause Autodiscover and profile creation to fail if your mailbox is in Office 365. You can ignore this warning if your mailbox is not in Office 365.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting

Rule.Name: sDisableBasicAuthSavedCredsPol15
Rule.Title: Unexpected prompt for password because DisableBasicAuthSavedCreds=1 as a group policy setting
Rule.Text:
DisableBasicAuthSavedCreds =1 as a group policy value in the registry under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\RPC. In this configuration, your credentials are not saved -- even if you select 'Remember my credentials' when prompted for your password.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: sDefConnectOptsPolZeroMapiHttpX86
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=15 and $bitness='x86' and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4701.1000')<0 and $fDefConnectOptsPol=0 and ($fMapiHttpMailstoreIntUrlOffline or $fMapiHttpMailstoreExtUrlOffline) and not($fMapiHttpDisabledPol=1 or ($fMapiHttpDisabledPol=-1 and $fMapiHttpDisabled=1))
Rule.Title: Unable to connect to mailbox because DefConnectOpts=0 plus MAPI/HTTP connection
Rule.Text:
Your Outlook profile is configured to connect with your Exchange mailbox using MAPI/HTTP and DefConnectOpts=0 in the registry under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\RPC. However, you may not be able to connect with your mailbox because you have an older build of Outlook installed.
If you are unable to connect to your mailbox, click the 'Click here ...' link to read the article that first addressed this issue. Or, click the 'Download the update ...' link for the latest Outlook update (32-bit).

Rule.Name: sDefConnectOptsPolZeroMapiHttpX64
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=15 and $bitness='x64' and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4701.1000')<0 and $fDefConnectOptsPol=0 and ($fMapiHttpMailstoreIntUrlOffline or $fMapiHttpMailstoreExtUrlOffline) and not($fMapiHttpDisabledPol=1 or ($fMapiHttpDisabledPol=-1 and $fMapiHttpDisabled=1))
Rule.Title: Unable to connect to mailbox because DefConnectOpts=0 plus MAPI/HTTP connection
Rule.Text:
Your Outlook profile is configured to connect with your Exchange mailbox using MAPI/HTTP and DefConnectOpts=0 in the registry under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\RPC. However, you may not be able to connect with your mailbox because you have an older build of Outlook installed.
If you are unable to connect to your mailbox, click the 'Click here ...' link to read the article that first addressed this issue. Or, click the 'Download the update ...' link for the latest Outlook update (64-bit).

Rule.Name: sTermServSpellStartTooHigh
Rule.Title: Possible performance issues due to the TerminalServerSpellingStart policy
Rule.Text:
Outlook may experience peformance problems or cause high CPU because the TerminalServerSpellingStart group policy value is set too high. The default value is 5000 (decimal). Please consider lowering the value specified for the policy.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOffPol
Rule.Title: VBA is disabled due to the VBAOff group policy value under HKCU
Rule.Text:
The VBAOff value is set to a value other than 0 as a policy under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this registry value.

Rule.Name: sHklmVBAOffPol
Rule.Title: VBA is disabled due to the VBAOff group policy value under HKLM
Rule.Text:
The VBAOff value is set to a value other than 0 as a policy under HKLM\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this registry value.

Rule.Name: sUseOnlineContentOffPol
Rule.Title: Weather feature in Outlook is disabled because of a group policy setting
Rule.Text:
The weather feature is disabled in Outlook because the 'Allow Office to connect to the Internet' option is not enabled (due to group policy) in the Trust Center.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: sUseOnlineContentZeroO365MbxPol
Rule.Title: Password prompt on every Outlook start because the UseOnlineContent=0 by group policy
Rule.Text:
In the registry, UseOnlineContent=0 under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\Internet. This configuration disables the 'Allow Office to connect to the Internet' option in the Trust Center. It also causes a prompt for your password every time you start Outlook.
Because this option is being controlled by group policy, your administrator will need to adjust this policy to stop the password prompts.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to re-enable this option.

Rule.Name: sSendToOneNoteMissingPol
Rule.Title: The OneNote icon is missing from the Outlook ribbon because of a group policy setting
Rule.Text:
Under Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\OneNote\Options\OutlookAndWeb in the registry, DisableSendEmailToOneNote=1. In this configuration Outlook does not display the OneNote icon on the ribbon.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this issue.
Note, because this setting is configured as a group policy, your administrator may have to change the policy.

Rule.Name: sMarkInternalAsUnsafe
Rule.Title: Office Documents will open only in Protected View
Rule.Text:
The MarkInternalAsUnsafe registry value is set to 1. Therefore, Office document attachments from internal senders will open in Protected View.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to change this registry value.

Rule.Name: sMarkInternalAsUnsafePol
Rule.Title: Office Documents open only in Protected View due to group policy setting
Rule.Text:
The MarkInternalAsUnsafe registry value is set to 1 through group policy, and Office document attachments from internal senders will open in Protected View. Please see your administrator if you need to change this policy.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this setting.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode is not set
Rule.Text: Outlook Default Security - This option is the default configuration in Outlook. Users can configure security themselves, and Outlook ignores any attachment or programmatic access security settings configured in Group Policy.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode0
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 0
Rule.Text: Outlook Default Security - This option is the default configuration in Outlook. Users can configure security themselves, and Outlook ignores any attachment or programmatic access security settings configured in Group Policy.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode1
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 1
Rule.Text: Use Security Form from 'Outlook Security Settings' Public Folder - Outlook uses the settings from the security form published in the designated public folder.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode2
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 2
Rule.Text: Use Security Form from 'Outlook 10 Security Settings' Public Folder - Outlook uses the settings from the security form published in the designated public folder.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode3
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 3
Rule.Text: Use Outlook Security Group Policy - Outlook uses security settings from Group Policy.

Rule.Name: CheckAdminSettings
Rule.Title: CheckAdminSettings group policy setting is ignored
Rule.Text:
The CheckAdminSettings registry value ={0} under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Security. It is not used by Outlook 2007 and above.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this scenario.

Rule.Name: sOrphans
Rule.Title: Orphaned Files in the Outlook Secure Temp folder
Rule.Text:
There {2} {0} file{3} in the Outlook Secure Temp Folder '%OLKSECTMPFOLDER%':
{1}

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Last Outlook crashes
Object.LogText: Collecting Application Event Log Entries for Last Outlook crashes

Rule.Name: sNoEvent1000Found
Rule.Text: No Outlook events with ID=1000 were found in the last 14 days of application event log items

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Full OAB Downloads
Object.LogText: Collecting Application Event Log Entries for Full OAB Downloads

Object.Name: Partial event data for full OAB download
You do not have any Offline Address Book files on your computer, or the Offline Address Book files could not be opened for some other reason.
You forced a full .oab file download manually.
The name of the Offline Address Book could not be obtained on the client. This behavior occurs when you create a new profile.
The GUID of the Offline Address Book could not be obtained on the client.
The name of the Offline Address Book was missing from the server. In this case, a full .oab file download is not expected to start or succeed, but it is logged anyway.
The GUID of the Offline Address Book was missing from the server. In this case, the full .oab file download is not expected to start or succeed, but it is logged anyway.
The server's Offline Address Book name and the client's Offline Address Book name are different.

The server's GUID and the client's GUID are different. This behavior can occur if the server had to regenerate a whole new Offline Address Book with the same name and then discarded the old set. Or, the client was moved between different forests.
The client's sequence number is bigger than the server.

You want detailed information in the Offline Address Book, but there is no detailed .oab file on your client. This behavior may occur if you manually force a download of the Offline Address Book, and then you click to clear the Download changes since last Send/Receive check box.
At least one .diff file was missing from the server.
The sum total of the .diff files to download may not be greater than 1/8 of the full .oab file for OAB version 3 or 1/2 for OAB version 4
You have the 'Allow SRS Full OAB Download' registry key set to 1, and your Send/Receive setting was set to always do a full download.

You do not have the locale of the Offline Address Book installed on your system, and you did a manual full .oab file download. Typically, Outlook updates the address book either once a month, when a conditions hits for such users, or when you download manually. Outlook uses these three methods to update the address book to avoid a condition that would cause a full download every day.
Applying the .diff file to the .oab file failed for some reason. Sometimes, Event #4 is triggered in this situation.

Rule.Name: sNoEvent27Found
Rule.Text: No Outlook events with ID=27 were found in the last 14 days of application event log items

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Event 19 - Outlook disconnects past 5 days
Object.LogText: Collecting Application Event Log Entries for Event 19

Object.Name: Event 19 â details for Outlook disconnects

Rule.Name: sEvent19Found
Rule.Title: At least one event for Outlook with ID=19 was found in the application event log.
Rule.Text:
At least one event with ID=19 was found in the application event log. Search for 'Event 19' in Configuration Details to see these events.
Click the 'Tell me more ...' link for details on the (Hex) error codes found in the event details.

Rule.Name: sNoEvent19Found
Rule.Text: No Outlook events with ID=19 were found in the last 5 days of application event log items

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Event 25 - Outlook connection failures past 5 days
Object.LogText: Collecting Application Event Log Entries for Event 19

Object.Key1: contains(string('%EVENT25MESSAGE%'),'Could not perform the desired operation. The selected command is not valid for this recipient.')

Rule.Name: sEvent25Found
Rule.Title: At least one event with ID=25 was found in the application event log.
Rule.Text:
At least one event with ID=25 was found in the application event log. Search for 'Event 25' in Configuration Details to see these events.
See KB article 2535656 for details on this event.

Rule.Name: sNoEvent25Found
Rule.Text: No Outlook events with ID=25 were found in the last 5 days of application event log items

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Add-ins Load Time
Object.LogText: Collecting Application Event Log Entries for Add-ins Load Time

Rule.Name: sAddinLoadtime
Rule.Title: Application Event Log Entries for Add-ins Load Time: {1}
