Object.LogText: Collecting Application Event Log Entries for Event ID 54

Rule.Name: sEvt542007
Rule.Title: Application Event Log Entries for Event ID 54: {1}

Rule.Name: sEvt542010
Rule.Title: Application Event Log Entries for Event ID 54: {1}

Rule.Name: sNoEvent54Found
Rule.Text: No Outlook events with ID=54 were found in the last 14 days of application event log items.

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Event 26

Rule.Name: sEvent26GmailFound
Rule.Title: {0} disconnection error(s) found in the application event log for a Gmail account.
Rule.Text: Over the past 5 days, {0} event(s) with ID=26 found in the application event log indicating a disconnection with a Gmail account. Search for 'Event 26' in Configuration Details to see the event, and click the 'Click here ...' link for a resolution.

Rule.Name: sEvent26NotFound
Rule.Text: No Outlook events with ID=26 were found in the last 5 days of application event log items.

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Event 25 - Network problems preventing Calendar access

Rule.Name: nEvent25CalendarErrorCount
Rule.Query: count(../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Message' and contains(lower-case(Value),'could not read the calendar') and contains(lower-case(Value),'network problems')])

Rule.Name: sCoexistSimpleMapi
Rule.Title: Error detected when trying to send email
Rule.Text: An error in the Microsoft Office Alerts log indicates you were previously unable to send a document or file from another application. In this scenario, Outlook 2013 must be running if you also have an earlier version of Outlook installed.

Rule.Name: sCouldNotReadCalendarNonPolicy
Rule.Title: "Could not read the calendar" error condition detected.
Rule.Text: The conditions for the error "Could not read the calendar. The connection to Microsoft Exchange is unavailable." have been detected.

Rule.Name: s350430
Rule.Title: Error attempting to update a distribution group found in the Office Alerts log
Rule.Text: The error: 'Changes to the public group membership cannot be saved.' was found in the Office Alerts log. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions ...' link and then consider using either Resolution 1 or 2 in the article.

Rule.Name: sThirtyCalendarLimitWarning
Rule.Title: 'More than 30 calendars cannot be viewed at once.' found in the Office Alerts log
Rule.Text: The error: 'More than 30 calendars cannot be viewed at once.' was found in the Office Alerts log. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions ...' link.

Rule.Name: nRuleNotSavedCount
Rule.Query: count(../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Message' and contains(Value,'rule cannot be saved')])

Rule.Name: sCloudSharedCalendarError301927
Rule.Title: Error attempting to access a shared calendar
Rule.Text:
The error: 'The folder you selected is not available' was found in the Office Alerts log and your configuration indicates you are experiencing the issue in KB article 3015578.
To resolve this problem, click the 'Click here ...' link and then install the update listed in the article.

Rule.Name: sShareFolderErrorDec2014C2R
Rule.Title: Error opening shared Inbox folder from another mailbox
Rule.Text:
The Microsoft Office Alerts log contains the error 'Outlook cannot display this view.' and you have the December 2014 build of Office 2013 Click-to-run installed. This is a known error with this build of Outlook.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on how to resolve this problem.

Rule.Name: nP3_0x80042FAECount
Rule.Query: count(../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Message' and contains(Value,'0x80042FAE') and contains(Value,'app could not be started')])

Rule.Name: sAppsForOutlookOnlineContentOff
Rule.Query: ((($fUseOnlineContentOff=0 or $fUseOnlineContentOff=1) and $fUseOnlineContentOffPol=-1) or $fUseOnlineContentOffPol=0 or $fUseOnlineContentOffPol=1) and $nP3_0x80042FAECount>0 and $appName='Outlook' and $n2DigitVersion=15
Rule.Title: Apps for Outlook do not display correctly (red 'x' shown)
Rule.Text: When you click on an App for Outlook, for example the Bing Maps app, the app does not display any information. Instead, you might see a red 'x' icon in the upper-left corner of the app. This occurs because the value of UseOnlineContent is not 2 in the registry under '{0}'

Rule.Name: nOffCAT3708Count
Rule.Query: count(../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Message' and contains(Value,'object could not be found')])

Rule.Name: sRedirectedPersonalPathPSTError
Rule.Title: Error when trying to add a .PST file to an Outlook profile
Rule.Text:
The Microsoft Office Alerts log contains the error 'An unknown error occurred, error code: 0x80070035'. This error occurred because the Personal value in the registry references a folder location '{0}' that was not available at the time you tried to add a .PST file to your profile.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on how to change the Personal value in the registry.

Rule.Name: sSearchLowPriorityConfigOff
Rule.Title: Possible computer performance issue with UseLowPriorityConfiguration=0 in the registry
Rule.Text: The UseLowPriorityConfiguration registry value = 0. This is a non-default configuration and you may see computer performance issues due to higher priority indexing.

Rule.Name: sSearchIndexingBackoffNotEnabled
Rule.Title: Possible computer performance issue with DisableBackoff=1 in the registry
Rule.Text: The DisableBackoff registry value = 1. This is a non-default configuration and you may see computer performance issues due to higher priority indexing.

Rule.Name: sEnableIndexingDelegateMailboxes
Rule.Title: EnableIndexingDelegateMailboxes=1
Rule.Text: If you have a shared Exchange mailbox in your profile, you may see performance issues as the folders in this shared mailbox are being indexed. More information: http://blogs.technet.com/mikelag/archive/2009/05/04/windows-desktop-search-and-the-implications-on-wan-performance.aspx

Rule.Name: sPreventIndexingOutlook
Rule.Title: Indexing has been disabled using a policy setting in the registry
Rule.Text: Indexing for Windows Desktop Search has been disabled in the registry. Consequently, searching for items in Outlook will take longer.

Rule.Name: sPreventIndexingUncachedExchangeFolders
Rule.Title: PreventIndexingUncachedExchangeFolders=0 in the registry
Rule.Text: The PreventIndexingUncachedExchangeFolders value is set to 0 in the registry. This configuration can cause performance issues with an Online mode profile.

Object.Name: Windows Search Service Office Outlook Protocol Handler

Rule.Name: sSearchFailureWin7x64OLx86
Rule.Title: Outlook search fails to return results due to improper registry data
Rule.Text:
The Windows registry contains a subkey that is in the wrong hive. This configuration causes Outlook searches to fail.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for detailed steps on how to resolve this problem.

Rule.Name: sWSearchDesktopInteract
Rule.Title: Windows Search Service has "Allow service to interact with Desktop" enabled
Rule.Text: If the Windows Search Service has the "Allow service to interact with Desktop" setting enabled, you may not see any search results in Outlook.

Rule.Name: iFilterDllPathTest
Rule.Text: Path ={0}

Rule.Name: iFilterCompanyName
Rule.Text: Company Name ={0}

Rule.Name: iFilterDllPathTestWow
Rule.Text: Path (from \Wow6432Node registry data) ={0}

Rule.Name: iFilterCompanyNameWow
Rule.Text: Company Name ={0}

Object.Name: Application Event Log entries for Search

Rule.Name: sPDFIndexingIssue10023_24
Rule.Title: Possible Outlook search or indexing issue (event 10023 or 10024)
Rule.Text: The PDF iFilter is registered and Event 10023 or 10024 was found in the Application Event log. This has been known to cause indexing issues in Outlook. Click the 'Click here...' link if you are unable to search for Outlook items or your indexing of Outlook items does not finish.

Rule.Name: sPDFIndexingIssue10023_24Wow
Rule.Title: Possible Outlook search or indexing issue (event 10023 or 10024)
Rule.Text: The PDF iFilter is registered (under \Wow6432Node) and Event 10023 or 10024 was found in the Application Event log. This has been known to cause indexing issues in Outlook. Click the 'Click here...' link if you are unable to search for Outlook items or your indexing of Outlook items does not finish.

Rule.Name: sMissingMAPIProtocolHandler
Rule.Title: Outlook search may not be functioning properly because Mapiph.dll is missing.
Rule.Text: Your Outlook search results may be incomplete because the file Mapiph.dll is missing from your Office installation.

Rule.Name: sESM
Rule.Title: Exchange System Manager is installed
Rule.Text: No results are returned when you search for e-mail items using Instant Search.

Rule.Name: sStartSearchComm
Rule.Title: Search from the Windows Start menu will not locate email messages
Rule.Text: Start_SearchComm=0 in the registry. In this configuration, you will not be able to search for email messages using the Windows Search feature. However, you will be able to search for email messages from within Outlook.

Rule.Name: sRecentNormalEmail15PreDotm
Rule.Title: Quick parts may be missing in Outlook
Rule.Text:
When you are creating an email message and you click the Quick Parts control, some or all of your quick part items may be missing. When you upgraded to Outlook 2013 the NormalEmail.dotm file was renamed to NormalEmail15Pre.dotm. This file contains any quick part entries you created in earlier versions of Outlook.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on how to get back your quick part entries from earlier versions of Outlook.

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlags
Rule.Title: Outlook will not start because it is configured for Compatibility Mode
Rule.Text: When you start Outlook the program does not successfully start. Instead, an error is displayed indicating 'Outlook has encountered a problem and needs to close'. This problem occurs when Outlook is configured to run in Compatibility mode for another version of Windows.

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlags15C2RWin8
Rule.Query: (starts-with(lower-case($.),'win') or starts-with(lower-case($.),'vista') or starts-with(lower-case($.),'nt4')) and versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.2')>=0 and $n2DigitVersion=15 and $nInstallType='ClickToRun'
Rule.Title: Outlook will not start because it is configured for Compatibility Mode
Rule.Text: When you start Outlook 2013 the program does not successfully start. Instead, an error is displayed indicating 'Outlook will need to be closed...' and there is a 'Repair Now' button in the error dialog. This problem occurs when Outlook is configured to run in Compatibility mode for an earlier version of Windows.

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlags15MSIWin8
Rule.Query: (starts-with(lower-case($.),'win') or starts-with(lower-case($.),'vista') or starts-with(lower-case($.),'nt4')) and versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.2')>=0 and $n2DigitVersion=15 and $nInstallType='MSI'
Rule.Title: Outlook will not start because it is configured for Compatibility Mode
Rule.Text: When you start Outlook 2013 the program does not successfully start. Instead, a 'Configuration Progress' dialog box is displayed. This problem occurs when Outlook is configured to run in Compatibility mode for an earlier version of Windows.

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlags15C2RMSIWin7
Rule.Query: (starts-with(lower-case($.),'win') or starts-with(lower-case($.),'vista') or starts-with(lower-case($.),'nt4')) and versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.1')=0 and $n2DigitVersion=15
Rule.Title: Outlook will not start because it is configured for Compatibility Mode
Rule.Text: When you start Outlook 2013 the program does not successfully start. Instead, an error is displayed indicating 'You need to create a Microsoft Outlook profile' followed by another error indicating 'Cannot open the Outlook window'. This problem occurs when Outlook is configured to run in Compatibility mode for an earlier version of Windows.

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlags14Win7
Rule.Query: (starts-with(lower-case($.),'win') or starts-with(lower-case($.),'vista') or starts-with(lower-case($.),'nt4')) and versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.1')=0 and $n2DigitVersion=14
Rule.Title: Outlook will not start because it is configured for Compatibility Mode
Rule.Text: When you start Outlook 2010 the program does not successfully start. Instead, an error is displayed indicating 'No Microsoft Outlook profiles have been created.' followed by another error indicating 'Cannot open the Outlook window...'. This problem occurs when Outlook is configured to run in Compatibility mode for an earlier version of Windows.

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlags14Win8
Rule.Query: (starts-with(lower-case($.),'win') or starts-with(lower-case($.),'vista') or starts-with(lower-case($.),'nt4')) and versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.2')>=0 and $n2DigitVersion=14
Rule.Title: Outlook will not connect because it is configured for Compatibility Mode
Rule.Text: When you start Outlook 2010 it does successfully connect with your mailbox. Instead, 'Disconnected' is displayed in the Outlook status bar. This problem occurs when Outlook is configured to run in Compatibility mode for an earlier version of Windows.

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlagsDisableThemes
Rule.Title: Cannot attach files to messages or import/open pst files
Rule.Text:
This problem occurs because the 'Disable visual themes' setting has been enabled on the Compatibility tab in the Outlook.exe Properties dialog box.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for information on how to change this setting.
Rule.Symptoms: Error message,Configuration (unsupported or problematic),Email attachments,File Open error

Rule.Name: sRunAsAdminRegistry
Rule.Title: Offline scan performed automatically by OffCAT
Rule.Text:
The properties of Outlook.exe are configured with the 'Run this program as an administrator' option (under the HKCU registry hive). This configuration causes OffCAT to automatically perform an Offline scan because OffCAT does not support Outlook running in the 'Run as administrator' context.
Click the 'Click here ...' link and then follow the instructions under the 'Per-User Setting' section in the article to make the changes that will allow you to get a Full scan using OffCAT.

Rule.Name: sRunAsAdminRegistryHKLM
Rule.Title: Offline scan performed automatically by OffCAT
Rule.Text:
The properties of Outlook.exe are configured with the 'Run this program as an administrator' option (under the HKLM registry hive). This configuration causes OffCAT to automatically perform an Offline scan because OffCAT does not support Outlook running in the 'Run as administrator' context.
Click the 'Click here ...' link and then follow the instructions under the 'Per-Machine Setting' section in the article to make the changes that will allow you to get a Full scan using OffCAT.

Rule.Name: missingOlAppPath
Rule.Title: OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing
Rule.Text: The OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing in HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\App Paths\OUTLOOK.EXE. Please run a repair of Office/Outlook.

Rule.Name: missingOlAppPathWow
Rule.Title: OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing
Rule.Text: The OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing in HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\App Paths\OUTLOOK.EXE. Please run a repair of Office/Outlook.

Rule.Name: sBCMVersion2013
Rule.Text: {0} translates to either 'BCM 2013' or 'BCM 2010 + update to work with Outlook 2013'

Rule.Name: sBCMVersion2010
Rule.Text: {0} translates to 'BCM 2010'

Rule.Name: sBCMNotInstalled
Rule.Text: Business Contact Manager is not installed

Rule.Name: sBCM2013AddinNotLoaded
Rule.Text:
The add-in for BCM 2013 is not loaded because the LoadBehavior value is not 3 under the following registry key.
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Office\Outlook\Addins\Microsoft.BusinessSolutions.eCRM.OutlookAddin.NativeConnect.5
Therefore, you will not have BCM functionality.

Rule.Name: sBCM2010AddinNotLoaded
Rule.Text:
The add-in for BCM 2010 is not loaded because the LoadBehavior value is not 3 under the following registry key.
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Office\Outlook\Addins\Microsoft.BusinessSolutions.eCRM.OutlookAddin.NativeConnect.4
Therefore, you will not have BCM functionality because the add-in for BCM 2010 is not loaded.

Rule.Name: sWindowsFirewallStatus
Rule.P0: if(not($MachineDetails_fWindowsFirewallServiceNotRunning),'Windows Firewall service is not running','Windows Firewall service is running')

Rule.Name: sBITSInfo
Rule.Query: not($sEnableBITSMaxBandwidth='not set') or not($sMaxTransferRateOnSchedule='not set') or not($sMaxTransferRateOffSchedule='not set') or not($sUseSystemMaximum='not set') or not($sMaxBandwidthValidFrom='not set') or not($sMaxBandwidthValidTo='not set')
Rule.Title: BITS Policy Settings

Rule.Name: sBITSServiceDisabled
Rule.Title: BITS service is either stopped or disabled
Rule.Text: The Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) is either stopped or disabled and your Offline Address Book may be out of date.

Rule.Name: sCDOInstalled
Rule.Title: Collaboration Data Objects (CDO) 1.2.1 is installed
Rule.Text: Collaboration Data Objects (CDO) 1.2.1 is not supported on a client with Outlook 2010 installed.

Rule.Name: sRSACertLengthRequireLT1024
Rule.Title: RSA certificate length requirement not set to default value (1024)
Rule.Text: Registry data was found on the client that modifies the default RSA certificate length requirement. Microsoft does not recommend customers use certificates less than 1024 bits long. The registry data should only be used as a temporary workaround.

Rule.Name: sBadDCOMValues
Rule.Title: Machine configuration settings may prevent opening Office document attachments
Rule.Text:
The DCOM settings on this computer may cause you to receive errors when you open Office documents from email attachments.
If you are unable to open email attachments, click the 'Click here ...' link for instructions on how to reconfigure your machine settings.

Rule.Name: sDefaultMailClient
Rule.Title: No email messages are sent from Outlook when completing a mail merge using the HTML e-mail format
Rule.Text: When you perform a mail merge from Microsoft Word, no email messages are sent from Microsoft Outlook when you use the HTML email message format for your mail merge. Click the 'Click here ...' link for the resolution to this problem.

Rule.Name: sMismatchedMSIComponentID15
Rule.Title: Errors sending email from other programs or mail merge due to incorrect registry data
Rule.Text: The value of the MSIComponentID in the registry is not correct for Outlook 2013. This configuration can cause 'no default mail client' errors when you start Outlook, try to send email from other applications, or try mail merge from Word. Please repair your Office 2013 installation or click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this issue.

Rule.Name: sMSIComponentID15CalCheckBlock
Rule.Title: OffCAT was unable to scan your calendar due to incorrect registry data
Rule.Text: The value of the MSIComponentID in the registry is not correct for Outlook 2013. This configuration prevents the Calendar Checking Tool (CalCheck) from functioning properly, so OffCAT did not scan your calendar for issues. Please repair your Office 2013 installation or click the 'Click here ...' link for details on this issue.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIcon
Rule.Title: Presence icons are hidden.
Rule.Text: Presence icons are not displayed in the user interface because TurnOffPresenceIcon > 0 under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\IM. To display presence icons again, change the value of TurnOffPresenceIcon to 0.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIntegration
Rule.Title: Presence integration is disabled
Rule.Text: Presence integration is disabled because TurnOffPresenceIntegration=1 under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\IM. To display presence information again, change the value of TurnOffPresenceIntegration to 0.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIconPol
Rule.Title: Presence icons are hidden.
Rule.Text: Presence icons are not displayed in the user interface because TurnOffPresenceIcon > 0 under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\IM. To display presence icons again, please ask your administrator to remove the group policy setting for this feature.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIntegrationPol
Rule.Title: Presence integration is disabled
Rule.Text: Presence integration is disabled because TurnOffPresenceIntegration=1 under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\IM. To display presence information again, please ask your administrator to remove the group policy setting for this feature.

Rule.Name: sNoPresenceEnabled
Rule.Title: Presence icons are missing.
Rule.Text: Presence icons are not displayed in the user interface because Enabled=0 under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\PersonaMenu. To display presence icons again, change the value of Enabled to 1.

Rule.Name: sNoPresenceEnabledPol
Rule.Title: Presence icons are missing.
Rule.Text: Presence icons are not displayed in the user interface because Enabled=0 under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\PersonaMenu. To display presence icons again, please ask your administrator to remove the group policy setting for this feature.

Rule.Name: sNonMicrosoftDefaultIMProvider
Rule.Title: Non-Microsoft Instant Messaging client '{0}' is configured as the default IM provider
Rule.Text:
The '{0}' client is configured as the default Instant Messaging provider. This is not necessarily a problem configuration. But, if you are using a Microsoft IM client (Lync, Communicator or Skype) as your IM client you may need to modify the registry.
Click the 'Tell me more ...' link for details.

Rule.Name: sNoContactFBStatus3rdPartyIMClient
Rule.Title: Free/busy status for contacts is not visible in a contact card
Rule.Text: Your configuration indicates a non-Microsoft instant messaging client set as the default. In this configuration you may not see free/busy status for users is not available in the contact card. Click the 'Click here ...' link and then install the update from article 2899536. You can also get the latest update for Outlook using the information in KB article 2625547.

Rule.Name: sOutlook15MsiPlusSfbC2R
Rule.Title: Outlook crashes and errors with Lync/Skype for Business
Rule.Text:
You have an 'MSI' installation of Outlook 2013 but your Skype for Business (formerly Lync) installation is 'Click-to-run'. This is an unsupported configuration and you can expect to see either crashes in Outlook or errors related to Outlook in Skype for Business.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on how to fix this issue.
Rule.Symptoms: Crash,Configuration (unsupported or problematic),Skype for Business integration

Rule.Name: sBypassProxyForLocalAddresses
Rule.Text: Bypass proxy server for local address ={0}

Rule.Name: sWinHttpProxyServers
Rule.Title: Proxy server(s) found in the registry which may cause problems with Out of Office, Free/Busy, and MailTip features
Rule.Text: Proxy server(s) found in the registry in the WinHttpSettings binary value under 'HKLM\Software\%WOW6432NODE%\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\Connections'. If you are having problems with Out of Office (OOF), Free/busy (Availability) or MailTips in Outlook, please click the 'Click here ...' link for additional information.

Object.Name: No proxy servers found in the WinHttpSettings binary value

Rule.Name: sDisableCachingOfSSLPages
Rule.Query: not($sDisableCachingofSSLPagesOverride) and ($sDisableCachingOfSSLPagesPol=1 or ($sDisableCachingOfSSLPagesPol=-1 and $sDisableCachingOfSSLPagesHKCU=1) or ($sDisableCachingOfSSLPagesPol=-1 and $sDisableCachingOfSSLPagesHKCU=-1 and $sDisableCachingOfSSLPagesHKLM=1))
Rule.Title: Images in email messages appear as a red X
Rule.Text:
When you are viewing an email message containing images, the image is not displayed. Instead, you see a red 'x' and an error message that starts with 'The linked image cannot be displayed'. This occurs because DisableCachingOfSSLPages = 1 under {0} in the registry. This registry data controls the 'Do not save encrypted pages to disk' setting in Internet Explorer.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for information on how to resolve this issue.

Rule.Name: sWWLIBVersion
Rule.Title: WWLIB version = {0}
Rule.Text: This version of wwlib.dll can cause Outlook to crash when doing a mail merge if the message contains a Helvetica Type 1 font. If you experience this problem please install at least December 2010 Cumulative Update for Word 2010.

Rule.Name: sMAPI32Version
Rule.Title: Mail Merge doesn't work
Rule.Text: Mail merge in Microsoft Word does not work on a computer that is running Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2.

Rule.Name: sBadMsoutlolb
Rule.Title: The file Msoutl.olb is not registered properly
Rule.Text: The file Msoutl.olb is not registered properly in the Windows Registry. In this situation, you may encounter problems performing a Mail Merge operation from Microsoft Word.

Rule.Name: sFileExtensionsWrongVersion
Rule.Query: $fSxS and ( ($fMsgUserChoiceProgID='not set' and $.!='Outlook.File.msg.15') or ($fMsgUserChoiceProgID!='not set' and $fMsgUserChoiceProgID!='Outlook.File.msg.15') )
Rule.Title: File extensions for Outlook are not associated with the latest installed Outlook version
Rule.Text: File extensions (like .msg) for Outlook are not associated with Outlook 2013. Therefore, if you double-click a .msg file it may open in an earlier version of Outlook.

Rule.Name: sBadApp
Rule.Title: 'No default mail client' errors sending files from Office programs
Rule.Text: A string value called 'Version' was found under the \MSMapiApps key in the registry. This configuration can cause errors when sending files from within Office programs. Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on the resolution.

Rule.Name: sBadAppWow
Rule.Title: 'No default mail client' errors sending files from Office programs
Rule.Text: A string value called 'Version' was found under the \MSMapiApps key in the registry (under \Wow6432Node). This configuration can cause problems when sending files from within Office programs. Click the 'Click here ...' link for details on the resolution.

Rule.Name: sUnicodeCharInProfileName
Rule.Title: Outlook may stop responding due to double-byte characters in the profile name ({0})
Rule.Text: Outlook may stop responding because Microsoft Lync incorrectly created profile information used by Outlook. This incorrect profile information is related to having extended characters in your Outlook profile name.

Rule.Name: sUnicodeCharInProfileName15
Rule.Title: Outlook may stop responding due to double-byte characters in the profile name ({0})
Rule.Text: Outlook may stop responding because Microsoft Lync incorrectly created profile information used by Outlook. This incorrect profile information is related to having extended characters in your Outlook profile name.

Rule.Name: sOldOLCWow
Rule.Title: Outlook Hotmail Connector is not up to date ({0})
Rule.Text: Please go to http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=24677 to install the latest Outlook Hotmail Connector for 32-bit versions of Outlook

Rule.Name: sOldOLC32
Rule.Title: Outlook Hotmail Connector is not up to date ({0})
Rule.Text: Please go to http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=24677 to install the latest Outlook Hotmail Connector for 32-bit versions of Outlook.

Rule.Name: sOldOLC64
Rule.Title: Outlook Hotmail Connector is not up to date ({0})
Rule.Text: Please go to http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=21305 to install the latest Outlook Hotmail Connector for 64-bit versions of Outlook 2010.

Rule.Name: Wd2007NotInstalled
Rule.Title: Microsoft Word 2007 is not installed
Rule.Text: You are using Outlook 2007 and Word 2007 is not installed. In this configuration, you will lose some functionality in Outlook and other Office programs. *Note* Updates for Word 2007 are still required as some Word 2007 files are installed by Office 2007.

Rule.Name: Wd2010NotInstalled
Rule.Title: Microsoft Word 2010 is not installed
Rule.Text: You are using Outlook 2010 and Word 2010 is not installed. In this configuration, you will lose some functionality in Outlook and other Office programs. *Note* Updates for Word 2010 are still required as some Word 2010 files are installed by Office 2010.

Rule.Name: Wd2013NotInstalled
Rule.Title: Microsoft Word 2013 is not installed
Rule.Text: You are using Outlook 2013 and Word 2013 is not installed. In this configuration, you will lose some functionality in Outlook and other Office programs. *Note* Updates for Word 2013 are still required as some Word 2013 files are installed by Office 2013.

Rule.Name: sWordPR
Rule.Title: The build number for winword.exe indicates a Private Release (PR) build
Rule.Text: The build number for winword.exe indicates a Private Release (PR) build. PR builds are intended only for testing and not production use.

Rule.Name: sZeroByteDefProfXML
Rule.Title: Outlook may not start because of a corrupted file
Rule.Text:
The %APPDATA%\Microsoft\Outlook\%DEFPROF%.xml file is zero bytes. This can prevent Outlook from starting. To solve this problem, start Outlook with the /resetnavpane switch or install the latest update for Outlook 2007.
Click the 'Click here ...' link to obtain the latest update.

Rule.Name: sTooManyShortcutsDefProf
Rule.Title: Large number of shortcuts detected: {0}
Rule.Text: Outlook may stop responding if you have 200 or more shortcuts in the Navigation Pane.

Rule.Name: sMissingVBAKey
Rule.Title: Registry data for Visual Basic for Applications is missing
Rule.Text: The registry is missing data for Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) in Office 2010. In this configuration, you may have some VBA functionality disabled.

Rule.Name: sMissingVBAKeyWin8
Rule.Title: Registry data for Visual Basic for Applications is missing
Rule.Text: The registry is missing data for Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) in Office 2010. In this configuration, you may have some VBA functionality disabled.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2RWow
Rule.Query: $f2013C2R and ($fA32 or $fB32 or $fCWow or $fD32 or $fE32) and '%BIT%'!='%WBIT%'
Rule.Title: Office 2013 configuration prevents VBA from running
Rule.Text: There is incorrect/missing registry data that is preventing VBA from running. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions to this issue' link for information on how to correct this issue.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2R32
Rule.Query: $f2013C2R and ($fA32 or $fB32 or $fC or $fD32 or $fE32) and '%BIT%'='x86' and '%BIT%'='%WBIT%'
Rule.Title: Office 2013 configuration prevents VBA from running
Rule.Text: There is incorrect/missing registry data that is preventing VBA from running. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions to this issue' link for information on how to correct this issue.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2R64
Rule.Query: $f2013C2R and ($fA64 or $fB64 or $fC or $fD64 or $fE64) and '%BIT%'='x64'
Rule.Title: Office 2013 configuration prevents VBA from running
Rule.Text: There is incorrect/missing registry data that is preventing VBA from running. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions to this issue' link for information on how to correct this issue.

Rule.Name: sPersonalFolderRedirected
Rule.Title: The Personal string value in the registry is configured with a non-default folder location
Rule.Text: The Personal string value in the registry references the location of your 'Documents' folder ({0}). If this is a network location, you may experience issues accessing or configuring .pst files. This is because the default location for Outlook .pst files is the Documents folder.

Rule.Name: sMissingAppData
Rule.Title: AppData registry value is missing
Rule.Text: The AppData registry value is missing in HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\User Shell Folders. This prevents the user to connect or create a new profile.

Rule.Name: sUserShellFoldersCacheNotDefault
Rule.Query: ((versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.3')=0) and ($UserShellFoldersCache!=lower-case('%userprofile%\appdata\local\microsoft\windows\INetCache'))) or ((versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.0')>=0 and versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.3')<0) and ($UserShellFoldersCache!=lower-case('%userprofile%\appdata\local\microsoft\windows\temporary internet files'))) or ((versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.0')<0) and ($UserShellFoldersCache!=lower-case('%userprofile%\local settings\temporary internet files')))
Rule.Title: The path for the Cache value under the \User Shell Folders key is not the default value
Rule.Text: When Outlook opens an email message containing an image, temporary files are written into the path specified by the Cache value in the registry. If this path is not the default setting, Outlook may be unable to render the image.

Rule.Name: sMSILogging
Rule.Title: Possible slowness issues because Windows Installer logging is enabled
Rule.Text:
Verbose logging for the Windows Installer is enabled in the registry. As this logging can generate many log files and disk space, it is recommended that you use this logging only for troubleshooting purposes. Please consider turning off this logging.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for instructions or click the 'Fix it' link for an automated solution.

Rule.Name: sMSILoggingWin8
Rule.Title: Possible slowness issues because Windows Installer logging is enabled
Rule.Text:
Verbose logging for the Windows Installer is enabled in the registry. As this logging can generate many log files and disk space, it is recommended that you use this logging only for troubleshooting purposes. Please consider turning off this logging.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for instructions. Note, the 'Fix it' solution in the article does not apply to Windows 8 (or later).

Rule.Name: sZeroConfigExchange
Rule.Title: ZeroConfigExchange = 1
Rule.Text: If your mailbox is on an Exchange 2003 server, you may receive an error message if you create a new profile when the ZeroConfigExchange registry value is set to 1.

Rule.Name: sZeroConfigExchangeP
Rule.Title: ZeroConfigExchange = 1 Policy is set
Rule.Text: If your mailbox is on an Exchange 2003 server, you may receive an error message if you create a new profile when the ZeroConfigExchange policy is set to 1.
